intro: Dendrobium farmeri var. albiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered orchid, is a species native to Southeast Asia. It is an epiphytic orchid that thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing on trees or rocks. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white flowers with a subtle scent, which bloom during the warmer months. Its pseudobulbs are thick and fleshy, storing water to help it survive dry periods. The leaves are narrow and革质, providing efficient photosynthesis in its natural habitat.
